Description: Silver pendant in shape of ram's head wearing uraeus, with incised details.
Curator's comments: A silver "fine ram's head with the uraeus on it (pl. xli, 11) (...) found in the camp, with two silver uraei, and a bronze Apis" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 75, p. 110 pl. xli, 11. For comparison, see for instance a similar gold item in New York, MM, 1989.281.98, and a lapis lazuli item in Boston, MFA, 1973.661, both considered as xxvth dynasty.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 75, p. 110, pl. xli, 11)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.42, p.45, p.47, p.48, p.49, p.86, p.187, pl.29)
Condition: good - the end of the left horn is broken
